section.title: Requirements
section.p: The Jmol application requires Java 1.4 or higher. The latest Java 2 Platform Standard Edition is recommended.

section.title: Downloading the application
section.p:
It can be downloaded using the following links:
jmol v$VERSION$
Binary and source packages are available, as well as Debian GNU/Linux, and Suse/RedHat Linux packages.

Debian users can also apt-get the package from mentors.debian.net by adding:
deb http://mentors.debian.net/debian unstable main contrib deb-src http://mentors.debian.net/debian unstable main contrib
to /etc/apt/sources.list, and doing 'apt-get update && apt-get install jmol/unstable'.

section.title: Downloading the applet
section.p: To use the applet, you must first download the applet distribution and extract the files. It can be downloaded from SourceForge.
JmolApplet.jar contains all the classes needed to support the Jmol applet. No other jar files are needed.
